Description: Fragment of black-figure pottery amphora (?); part of base and lower part of body (foot missing); reconstructed from two joining fragments; reddish/black horizontal stripes around the body, alternating narrow and broad, lower part of figured zone with foot of male figure. Hard, fine, orange/brown clay, Munsell between 10R 6/6 and 2.5YR 6/6 (light red); many white inclusions.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: Findspot number '19A W' scratched by Petrie.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 361)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.208)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
